content:
Intents:

Get Cozy: First, set up your space. The last thing anyone wants to do when they're sick is have to keep getting up. Grab your favorite throw blanket, light a candle, and stock up on stuff to keep you busy.
Call Your Mom: There's no one like Mom to make you feel better when you're home sick—no matter how old you are.
Nourish Yourself: There's a reason grandmothers everywhere swear by chicken noodle soup. Heal your body with this age-old cold remedy, even if you don't have much of an appetite.
Have a Movie Marathon: What better time to catch up on all those movies you've been meaning to watch than when you just can't make it out of bed?
Read a Book: Normally too busy to read for fun? A sick day at home means you have all the time in the world to dedicate to a good book.
Start a Journal: Take a break from reading and pick up a pen. Looking inward can be an easy way to boost your mood when you're home sick.
Upgrade Your Space: If you're feeling up to it, consider a little redecorating. If you've been itching for a simple and inexpensive way to freshen up your space, now's your chance to do some rearranging.
Listen to Something: There's nothing like a good playlist or your favorite podcast to put you in a better mood. Crank up the tunes and forget about being sick for a while.
Binge a New Series: Staying home sick is an automatic pass to indulge in a day of Netflix. After all, it is the ideal time to binge all those shows you've been meaning to watch.
Browse the Internet: Whether you're online shopping or getting lost down a Wikipedia rabbit hole, the Internet has a way of providing entertainment for hours.
Go for a Walk: If you've been resting in bed surrounded by tissues all day, it might be a good idea to get some fresh air. Not quite ready for a walk? Grab a chair and breathe in the great outdoors from your backyard.
Do a Puzzle: Take the focus off of being sick and keep your brain busy with a beautiful puzzle. If you're looking for a real challenge, try a completely clear one.
Take a Bath: There's nothing like the warm embrace of bathwater when you're all stuffed up. Fill your tub with a soothing bath bomb to clear your sinuses and start feeling better.
Sleep: When you're home sick, sometimes all you need is sleep. Consider this official permission to doze the day away.

Entities:

Electronic_device: laptop, computer, smartphone, ipod, ipad, kindle
Comfort_item: throw blanket, candle, chicken noodle soup, puzzle, bath bomb
Electronic_entertainment: podcast, playlist, Netflix, internet

For the following utterance, identify any intents along with any corresponding entities.  The entities should be nested under the intent where they appear in the description. Output your findings in a json.

Utterance:
While calling my mom on my smartphone while I was at home, sick and binging a show on netflix, I accidentally dropped it in the chicken soup I was eating.
